TopicTitle: What do you name your space agencies?

Articles.Content: Addiction Aerospace

Panda Space Agency.

Says it all really...  my flag is a stylised panda face in front of a St Georges cross.

Originally came from a comment a work colleague made about my surname rhyming with 'pandas' and the joke stuck.
Kersplat Aerospace Industries is the major aerospace engineering firm that handles all constructions for the Directory of Space Exploration and Colonization (DSEC)

default

career

screwing around

default1

default2

etc.

I'm not creative.

I've gone by a couple of names, the least-used one is the Kerbal Space Exploration Coalition, or KSEC, because I wanted a cool-sounding acronym. Kay-sek sounds really cool for a space program whilst keeping Kerbal in it. Other than that, I've used my personal name for a rocketry company, AstroTek Aerospace, but the one I make use of, because it's a single player game and ubiquitous, is just 'the Kerbal Space Program' because that's what I'm in charge of.
KIAA, Or Kerbal International Aerospace Administration, I think it fits my headcanon pretty well without sounding too NASA-y.
My current save is called "Replicas."
I learnt how to make space planes last week, so new save: Kerbal Spaceplane Program
I call it "aether space tech" or "aether space agency" but i prefere the first one. Specialized in wobbly rockets and landing disasters.

National Astronautics Agency.

 

Yep, I'm a boring one.

KAERA or Kerbal Aerospace Engineering Research Administration.

See siggy for flag.

Blorbian Space Program

However I use the Blorbs flag, that logo is just for non important missions or as a decal

Edited March 13, 2016 by nosirrbro

19 hours ago, dragonaether said:

I call it "aether space tech" or "aether space agency" but i prefere the first one. Specialized in wobbly rockets and landing disasters. 

Given the similarities in our forum handles, it doesn't surprise me that we have related agency names (with the intentional misspelling in mine, of course.)  "Aetharcorp Aerospace" for career saves, "Aetharcorp Experimentals" for general mucking-around sandboxes.  If I'm focusing on a specific challenge and want it to have its own save file (one of these days, I'll successfully complete the Elcano challenge!), then that save generally just gets named after the challenge in question.

UKSI for United Kerbin Space Initiative. The idea came after seeing some concept art-thing about a space shuttle successor owned by a space agency called the United Nations Space Initiative. Change the United Nations to United Kerbin, and viola, semi-original space agency name. It also can allow me to explain why there's a mix of Soviet & U.S. tech and a complete lack of a space race.

Since I have a terrible habit of forgetting what each save is, I just name things "____ Science." To stop myself from burning out on career, I name it "I WILL BEAT THIS" or something along those lines.

Sandbox or Career 

 

I'm boring

Avalon Astronautics is the Company that manufactures most (currently all) of the parts in my mods. So for the name to my space agency, I just used it & an extra word to make... Avalon Astronautics Alliance!!!!

K.A.A.A.

 

Kerbol Aeronautics and Aerospace Association

 

It's also the sound Kerbals make when they crash and burn.
DMSP. That's my space program name.
My first was "Kerbal Aeronautic and Orbital Services" or K.A.O.S
Aurora Space Industries

On 5/18/2013 at 2:08 PM, GalaxyGryphon said:

I keep trying to make some up but they all sound to much like NASA because Aeronautics, Space, and Agency are all words i want to use.

anyway, post yours.

Aquila Aerospace.

The save is named after the goal, YouTube series name, or main mod that I'm using. So I've had "Kerpollo", "New Horizons," and "Grand Tour" save games.

However, those aren't really the name of my space program. That name is "Kerbal Space Program." And I'm mostly just assuming that because nowhere does it say the name in the game and I've never really considered it.
...Bada** Aerospace...

Not very original, but at least I made my own KASA flag (which I'm sure has been done before too)...

Edited March 17, 2016 by blorgon
